basics.title: Basics of C Programming
basics.description: Introduction to C programming language, variables, data types, operators, and control structures

content.text: C is a general-purpose programming language developed by Dennis Ritchie at Bell Labs in the early 1970s. It is a procedural language that provides low-level access to memory and is widely used for system programming.

functions.title: Functions in C
functions.description: Understanding functions, parameters, return values, and scope in C

content.text: Functions are blocks of code that perform specific tasks. They help in organizing code, reusability, and modularity.
Functions can receive parameters in two ways: pass by value and pass by reference using pointers.

arrays.title: Arrays, Strings, and Pointers
arrays.description: Working with arrays, strings, and pointers in C

content.text: Arrays are collections of elements of the same data type stored in contiguous memory locations.
In C, strings are arrays of characters terminated by a null character '\0'.
Pointers are variables that store memory addresses.

structures.title: Structures, Unions, and Enum
structures.description: Understanding user-defined data types in C

content.text: Structures allow grouping different data types together under a single name.
Unions are similar to structures, but all members share the same memory location.

memory.title: Memory Management
memory.description: Dynamic memory allocation using malloc, calloc, realloc, and free

content.text: C provides functions to allocate memory dynamically during runtime.

files.title: File Handling
files.description: Reading from and writing to files in C

content.text: C provides functions to perform file operations like creating, opening, reading, and closing files.
